title: Two gray tourists: from papers of Mr. Philemon Perch
author: Johnston, Richard Malcolm
snippet: Not far off were Airth Castle and Dunmore Park, and Tonwood Forest, at one time the hiding-place of Wallace,  at another, the scene of the excommunication of Donald Cargill, the fierce Covenanter.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: Duke ofHamilton, Kinneil Castle, on the south side of theriver; next, the Earl of Dunmore, Dunmore Park,also on the south side of the river; Lord Abercromby,
